server
Class Data

java.lang.Object
  server.Data

public class Data
extends java.lang.Object

A singleton class to hold references to all of the data on the server. This can be called anywhere and allows any part of the server to access the data in it at any time. Apparently doing this as a singleton is a bad idea. I disagree. The reason against this seems to be that it makes it more difficult to debug, you can't tell which classes changed the data because anything can access it. Oh really, what about doing a search for Data.getInstance()?
